alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 10:32PM EDT until April 03 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale, Shoals, Williams, Seymour, and Bedford. Big Blue River at Shelbyville. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Columbus. Driftwood River near Edinburgh. Sugar Creek near Edinburgh. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana... Flatrock River near Columbus. .Significant rainfall of 2 to nearly 5 inches last week has resulted in widespread lowland flooding along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers, along with several smaller tributaries. Moderate flooding is occurring on a small portion of the East Fork White River, and is expected to develop in the coming days on the lower reaches of the White and Wabash Rivers. Water continues to rise in many locations. The crests on the main stem rivers are in the following locations currently. On the Wabash, near Lafayette. On the White, near Spencer, and along the East Fork White, between Seymour and Rivervale. Most smaller tributaries are past crest and falling. Flooding will likely last for a week or more in some areas, particularly in southwest Indiana along the lower reaches of the main stem rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, APRIL 03... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River near Rivervale. * WHEN...Until Monday, April 03. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Extensive river flooding in progress. Residential areas near the river begin to flood. The county bridge locally known as the Buddha bypass bridge becomes inaccessible. Several local roads are flooded including Duncan Rd/Tunnelton Rd, Fort Ritner at the underpass and post office, Old Buddha Rd, Tunnelton Rd at the railroad crossing and West Sparksville Bridge Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EDT Sunday was 20.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.7 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, April 03. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
